strings.string: Outlaws and guard dogs emerge from a secret hiding place. "Who sent you?"\r
\r"Ugly would have given you a password if he had sent you!"\r
\rThis is a ceiling to floor glass wall.\r
\rYou're lucky no one was cut by flying glass.\r
\rThe unlucky ones are picking chunks of glass out of themselves.\r
\rThere are glass walls near the entry and a glass-enclosed atrium to the west.\r
\rThe glass door opens quietly. The air inside is warm and moist.\r
\rThe atrium walls are mostly glass and are three stories high.\r
\rWith luck and ability you might be able to climb the walls.\r
\rA hidden tunnel disappears under some rocks.\r
Marksmen crouch in the doorway with pistols lipping flame!\r
A pug-faced man laughs and lets the hungry mongrels loose to attack.\r
\rYou hear voices shouting in the next room.\r
\rYou better move quietly. You can hear guards' voices in the room to the north.\r
\rYou climb the stairs to the second floor.\r
\rA sign near the descending stairs reads: 2nd Floor.\r
\rThe sign next to the stairs reads: 1st Floor.\r
\rA sign near the ascending stairs reads: 2nd Floor.\r
\rThis is not a good place to climb the wall because the ceiling slopes in overhead.\r
\rThe vines barely support you. You can climb down here, but not up.\r
\rYou slide through the leaves and land safely.\r
\rYou slipped when the vines gave way.\r
\rThe vines are slippery but you safely climb down a level.\r
\rThese file cabinets have nothing of interest in them.\r
\rThis is a locked steel vault door.\r
\rThe guard at the corner frowns at you.\r
"I don't know you. What's the word?"\r
\rYou made so much noise that you'll be lucky if no one comes after you.\r
\rWith an Errol Flynn leap, you jump onto the table!\r
\rYou easily open the door and see a sleeping guard leaning against the wall.\r
\rThe guard is asleep. You might overpower him before he can sound the alarm.\r
\rHe was pretending to sleep! He starts yelling for help!\r
\rYou wrestle with him and knock him out without a sound.\r
"Huey, help me! Dewey, get out here now!" He lunges at you with his knife.\r
A huge man with a strawberry mark on his face aims his rifle at you.\r
The outlaws draw a dead aim on you.\r
The outlaws are very surprised but they go for their guns.\r
"You killed my brother!" says an identically marked man. "You're gonna regret it."\r
\rYou can easily see that these men, both with a large strawberry birthmark, are twins.\r
\rYou hear harsh voices beyond the door, and someone moaning.\r
\rA dead man, the victim of torture, is tied to a chair.\r
\rA tortured and dying man is sitting in the chair. He needs a drink fast.\r
\rHe is recovering. He blinks and opens his eyes. "Thank you," he says.\r
\rThe hardship was too much. The man coughs and dies.\r
\r"I am Danny Citrine. The triplets wanted our cash. Dad and I hid it under their noses."\r
\r"I see you've rescued Mayor Pedros, I will help you get him out of here if you wish."\r
\r"Let me help you to rescue the mayor. Let me lead you back to the cell and the guards will let us go on by."\r
"Taking Danny back to his cell? Go on. It's down there."\r
\rOne scratches his dirty chin and decides that discretion is the better part of valor. "Well don't stop, keep moving."\r
\rYou are at the top floor. Vines on the south wall are the only way down.\r
\rA sign hangs from the ceiling by rusty chains. Quartz City Jail.\r
\rA faded wall poster says, "Do yourself a favor and stay clean!"\r
\rThe outlaw nods as he leaves. About time he was taken back to his cell.\r
\rThe outlaw grunts as he leaves. "You look like you know what is what. Not my problem."\r
\rOthers come running at the sound of fighting.\r
\rYou see meeting rooms through the glass. You can climb up but not down. Vines on the south wall indicate a way down.\r
You interrupt a very serious game of poker.\r
"Hi. I'm Mayor Pedros. Please rescue me."\r
\rGraffiti on the wall here says "Darwin = Proteus."\r
Watch out! This guy is nuts.\r
\rA man leaps out of the bed.\r
\rHe sees Danny and says, "Thanks for rescuing me, son. Here's the money. I must run now."\r
\rBefore you can react, he runs out of the cell.\r
\rYou open the cell and set off an alarm. Uh oh!\r
The gunsels go for their pistols. They look like they can use them!\r
The scruffy guard dogs attack. Their knife wielding masters close behind.\r
You hear the cocking of a rifle. The rifleman is waiting to blow you away.\r
\rThe outlaws look baffled, glancing uncertainly at each other.\r
\r"Boy, he is giving himself airs!" one of them says. "Go on in, but it better be important!"\r
\rOne short scruffy man growls, "I don't know what yer doin, but it ain't gonna work."\r
\rThis is a plain wall, quite sturdy although stained and dirty.\r
The noise brings gang members out of the woodwork. More thugs to shoot at you.\r
Slavering, hungry, iron jawed dogs bound toward you. You're a bag of dog chow in their eyes!\r
\rThis is a rock wall. You can't climb here.\r
An angry voice shouts from the atrium, "Whaddya think you're doing there?"\r
\r"Hey! What are you doing in here?"\r
\rYou see a couple of thugs in the hall staring at you.\r
\rYour recruit says, "I bet we could break the glass and climb down the plants."\r
\rA fat guy locks the door and looks curiously at you.\r

but fail

 to inflict any damage

\x0f of them
 into a scarlet side of meat
